channel.title: Moparscape Homepage
channel.description:
There is now a homepage where the webclient used to be located, the homepage is still in early development and we look to change things, and add new pages in the future. I think the information on the homepage itself explains the rest.
https://www.moparisthebest.com/
Everything can be accessed via the navigation bar including the webclient that used to reside there. If you would like to contribute please read the homepage for more information.

item.title: Moparscape Homepage
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

[quote=“Ruby, post:261, topic:517782”]That’s the default octopress theme, I didn’t make it lol.

If that was the case that’d mean Mopman stole my theme too :|[/quote]

Sounds like the case of the M.dog compiler. To bad we don’t have a theme that is like SMF default.

Read full topic

item.title: Moparscape Homepage
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

the elve age:

We say this because it was your idea in the first place to add it. Stop generalizing the public because your post was aimed at me. If you didn’t have the proper time to write a real homepage why did you do in the first place? I know nothing about web development and I won’t have time until school starts. You’d think what we’re asking isn’t too major. I just don’t understand why you guys decided to make this homepage and not update it to the normal ‘standards’.

No it wasn’t aimed at you, it’s aimed towards everyone. Not just on the styling front, on the contribution front too. What do you mean write a real homepage? There’s no such thing. I was well into writing a static homepage but Moparisthebest wanted to use blogging software. We made it this because it’s a massive improvement on what we had before and chose this software because it wouldn’t just be down to staff members to deal with it. If people were to actually visit the OctoPress site and/or google things they’d find them simply.

Here’s some themes, take a look.

GitHub

imathis/octopress

octopress - Octopress is an obsessively designed framework for Jekyll blogging. It’s easy to configure and easy to deploy. Sweet huh?

Read full topic

item.title: Moparscape Homepage
item.dc:creator: @Ambokile Ambokile
item.description:
@Ambokile wrote:

I had a skim through the Github repo and I didn’t have a clue where to start about editing the styling of the page. If you gave a small explanation, Ruby, then I’m sure people would be willing to make a few modifications here and there.

Read full topic

item.title: Moparscape Homepage
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

I don’t know how many times we’re gonna have to say this, this homepage is on github. You can write a theme for it and stick in a pull request. “This should be looked into” isn’t really grounds for it, find someone who can do it or learn how to do it yourself, it really wouldn’t take long. For example, SilentCJ and I are two active mods who are web developers but he works like 3 jobs or something and mines takes up ridiculous amounts of time, especially when I’m supposed to be available 24/5. If you guys like an idea go and do it instead of just saying “I like this, I like that, this should be looked into”. That’s one of the massive advantages of Octopress, everything is made available to everyone.

Read full topic
